problems.q: A rectangle has area $96\,\text{m}^2$ and perimeter $40\,\text{m}$. Find its dimensions.
An object is launched so that its height (in metres) is $h(t)=-5t^2+20t$. At what times is it $15\,\text{m}$ high?
The product of two consecutive positive integers is $72$. Find the integers.
A right triangle’s legs differ by $2\,\text{m}$ and the hypotenuse is $10\,\text{m}$. Find the legs.
Find all rectangles with integer side lengths (in metres) whose area equals their perimeter (in metres).
A garden is a rectangle whose length is $2\,\text{m}$ more than its width. If the area is $48\,\text{m}^2$, find its dimensions.
A positive number and its reciprocal have sum $\tfrac{5}{2}$. Find the number(s).
A rancher has $48\,\text{m}$ of fencing to make two adjacent rectangular pens in a row (one interior fence parallels a long side). What dimensions maximize total area?
A convex polygon has $44$ diagonals. How many sides does it have?
A ball’s height is $h(t)=-5t^2+20t+3$. When is it back at its starting height?
A parent and child have ages that sum to $48$ and have product $432$. Find their ages.
A right triangle has area $60\,\text{m}^2$ and legs that differ by $2\,\text{m}$. Find the legs.
The product of two consecutive even positive integers is $168$. Find the integers.
A triangle has base $5\,\text{cm}$ longer than its height. If its area is $52\,\text{cm}^2$, find base and height.
A square and a rectangle have the same perimeter $48\,\text{m}$. If the rectangle’s area is $140\,\text{m}^2$, find the rectangle’s dimensions.
Each side of a square field is increased by $3\,\text{m}$, increasing the area by $90\,\text{m}^2$. Find the original side length.
An archway follows $y=-(x-3)^2+9$ (metres). How far from the left end ($x=0$) is the arch exactly $5\,\text{m}$ high?
Find two positive numbers whose sum is $11$ and whose product is $30$.
A rectangle’s length exceeds its width by $3\,\text{m}$. If its area is $180\,\text{m}^2$, find its dimensions.
A stone is thrown downward from a height so that its height is $h(t)=-4t^2-4t+32$ (metres). When does it hit the ground?
